title.narrative: COVID-19 Initiative Africa 2018-2021, Gender equality making change happen

description.narrative:
Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19 The overall objective of the intervention is to strenghten gender equality in Ethiopia. The intervention will contrbute to that by addressing some of the underlying causes to gender inequality in the country; gender based violence. The intervention puts the woman/girl in the centre and will try to address violence in instituions and places where a woman/girl moves around through life and by including institution that may have positive catalytic effect on gender equality. Those are schools, workplaces and the media.
The agreement partner to the Embassy is Initiative Africa, a well known NGO with whom the Embassy has worked with before. The intervention will be jointly funded by Sweden, Packard Foundation and Austria Aid. It is proposed that Sweden contributes with an amount of SEK 11 390 000 for July 2018- Juni 2021.

Omprogrammerade medel för att bekämpa covid-19 Insatsens övergripande mål är att bidra till ökad jämställdhet i Etiopien. Detta planerar man göra genom att fokusera på en av de underliggande orsakerna till bristande jämställdhet i landet, nämligen våld mot kvinnor. Insatsen tar kvinnan/flickan i centrum och fokuserar insatsen på institutioner som en flicka/kvinna passerar i livet samt institutioner som kan ha en stor katalytisk effekt. Det rör sig om skolan, arbetslivet och media.
Insatsen har valt ut ett antal skolor, privata företag, offentliga institutioner och mediahus inom vilket arbetet ska pågå. Media spelar en roll som både budbärare och arbetplats. Insatsen ska genomföras i partnership med Initiative Africa som är Ambassadens avtalspart, samt Unicef och UNFPA. Insatsen finansieras gemensamt av Ambassaden/Sida, Packard Foundation och Austria Aid.
Det föreslås att Ambassaden finansierar insatsen med ett belopp om SEK 11 390 000 under perioden juli 2018- juni 2021.

The overall goal of the project is to; "contribute to the country's development goals of increasing women's participation, leadership, influence and decision making". The intervention is focuses on workplaces, schools and communities and the media. Within the three focus areas of workplaces, school and communities and the media the immediate objectives are: 1. Workplaces Achieve a minimum of 25% of women in the decision making structure of the private sector and para-statals of Ethiopia by 2021, by strengthening the institutional capacity of these organisations to mainstream gender issues into all their policies and programmes. 2. Schools and communities Combating violence against girls - Assist high school girls in 92 schools to gain confidence and capacity they need to get rid of gender based violence in schools and their community by making their voice heard and taken into account. Meeting the sexual and reproductive health needs of adolescents - Improve the sexual and reproductive health and rights of 90% of adolescents aged 14-20 in 20 schools, by establishing and/or strengthening school health/sport clubs and provide training to improve their reproductive health and HIV prevention capacity. 3. Media Help secure women's rights and gender equality by mobilising the media to adopt self-regulatory measures, internal codes of conduct and develop standards in media coverage that promotes gender equality, a balanced participation of women and men in management posts, non-stereotyped images and avoid sexist advertising, language and content.

description.narrative: During 2019, Initiative Africa with it's Making Change Happen project, was able to target six regional states of Ethiopia. As stated above, IA was able to accomplish its goals working with secondary and tertiary schools, media houses, local governments, CSOs and business people. Out of the achieved results, the development of the two strategic tools to implement gender mainstreaming in the media sector as well as the School Violence Index tool being implemented in some 96 schools across the nation come at the top. The baseline assessment report that was carried out in companies operational plan and program cycle and the extent of which these plans had gender perspective was also one of the achieved results. Other achievements focus on various trainings and capacity building of youth health and sports club for young girls. The civic engagement aspect was also another area in which visible achievements could be seen, especially in light of the 25 discussion forums held in five universities of the country. Another successful result is the communication results. IA has been able to produce and broadcast high quality short videos in partnership with known media houses in the country as well as publishing articles including cartoon in some of the known newspaper and magazines circulating nationwide. School clubs run by students have benefited from capacity building initiatives as well as communication tools for the fight against bullying, gender based violence and for targeted SRH related messaging.
